intro: Aplotaxis sorocephala, commonly known as the mountain sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by woody, spherical fruits. Its leaves are small, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Aplotaxis sorocephala is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
